lead_paragraph: Dino Toso is leaving Renault after five seasons as head of the Formula One team’s aerodynamic technology. Renault has won two F1 constructors’ championships and never finished lower than third since Toso took charge of the department in 2003. Renault won in 2005 and ’06 but has slipped to seventh in the 10-team standings, with only 9 points going into the eighth of 18 grand prix races this season. Dirk de Beer will replace Toso as head of Renault’s aerodynamics department.
